Screen_Equipment: Television; video cassettes; computer games; radio
Exposure_Definition: hours of exposure during the last week to each of 4 types of electronic media
Covariates_Adjusted: Sex; age; race; socioeconomic status; maternal educational level; the participants’ marital status and highest level of educational attainment at follow-up

Exposure_Definition: the number of hours per day spent viewing TV before and after school; daily number of hours per day spent playing computer games
Covariates_Adjusted: follow-up time; sex; school id; parental education level; parental marital status; smoking status; alcohol intake; BMI; cardiorespiratory fitness

Exposure_Definition: Hours per day spent on a computer (including playing video or computer games or using a computer for something that is not school work) and watching TV/video programs on a usual weekday and on a usual weekend day
Covariates_Adjusted: Age; sex; residential background; BMI; perceived family economic status; smoking; alcohol intake; sleeping behavior; exercise after school; physical activity

Exposure_Definition: hours per day spent on watching television, computer use, and texting on a weekend and on a weekday
Covariates_Adjusted: sex; depression measured at age 15 years; IQ; maternal age at delivery; maternal anxiety/depression; maternal education; parental socioeconomic status; parental conflict; presence of the child’s father; number of people living in the child’s home; bullying; early family TV use; exercising; talking on a landline phone

Exposure_Definition: Hours spending watching TV on an average school day; hours spent playing video or copmuter games or using a computer something that is not school work on an average school day
Covariates_Adjusted: sex; age; race/ethnicity; physical activity; socioeconomic status; BMI; baseline major depressive disorder; baseline computer/videogame use; baseline television viewing

Exposure_Definition: using mobile phone >=4 hours per day
Covariates_Adjusted: living in a rural or suburban area; only child; parental education level; parents being migrant workers; family income; life styles and health conditions; smoking; drinking; chronic medical conditions; perceived study stress; perceived study interest; living expenses; BMI

Exposure_Definition: hours spent online each week (tertiary categorization)
Covariates_Adjusted: socioeconomic position; previous mental health problems

Exposure_Definition: frequency of playing games on a computer or games console, leisuretime internet use, and visiting a social networking website on the internet (4-point Likert scale: most days; at least once a week; at least once a month; less often/never)
Covariates_Adjusted: BMI; bullying; emotional symptoms at baseline; socioeconomic position; maternal depression diagnoses; physical activity

Screen_Equipment: Television; video games; talking on the phone; internet surfing; texting/messaging/emailing
Exposure_Definition: daily time spent (1) watching/streaming television shows or movies; (2) playing video/computer games; (3) talking on the phone; (4) surfing the internet; and (5) texting, messaging, emailing
Covariates_Adjusted: age; sex; race/ ethnicity; BMI; household income; previous year anxiety and depressive symptoms
